headline: Kale and Quinoa Salad
description: Kale, quinoa, currants, pecans, and feta cheese are tossed in a basic vinaigrette in this salad recipe.
name: Kale and Quinoa Salad
recipeIngredient: 10 leaves kale, cut into small pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Stir quinoa into the boiling water, reduce heat to medium-low, place cover on the saucepan, and cook until water absorbs into the quinoa, about 12 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat and let rest covered for 5 minutes. Remove cover and allow quinoa to cool completely.
Put kale in a large mixing bowl.

Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, garlic, pepper, and salt together in a bowl until oil emulsifies into the mixture; drizzle over kale. Add cooled quinoa, pecans, currants, and feta cheese to the dressed kale and toss to incorporate.

review.reviewBody: Really great hearty salad. Flavors work together well, but I feel like the dressing needs something a little sweet as well. Might try to add some maple syrup next time I make it!
Can use dried cranberries instead of currents

What kind of barbarian doesn’t massage their kale?!?!! Kidding- but seriously, massage the kale with the dressing. I also go heavy on the dressing (not quite double, but I tend to overflow my measuring spoons). I also swap in goat cheese for feta when I’m feeling a lil crazy- but only about 1/3 cup (a little crumbled goat cheese goes a long way). Nutritious n delicious!
Tasty and virtuous. I’ll make it again but will make 50% more dressing next time. I find it a bit dry. Definitely massage the kale with the dressing and let it sit while the quinoa cools.
YUM!!!! I massaged the kale, that was the only change.
Best salad! I adjusted the recipe for two since it was just me eating it. I used almonds, massaged the kale, ate the whole thing! I’ll be making it again.
Preferred cranberries to currants. Also needed to add some balsamic vinegar to enhance taste. If kale leaves are big only need half. Also needs more dressing.

It was hot today and I wanted to make a salad that gave us greens and carbs. I don’t use quinoa that much, even though I like it. I came across this recipe but didn’t have a full larder so I made some substitutions. For ingredients I switched out currants and used dried cranberries instead. I also didn’t have any feta, so substituted in an aged sharp cheddar instead. I cooked the quinoa in a rice cooker. The menu says a 2:1 water/quinoa ratio which I used although the package stated a 4:1 ratio. I will try upping the ratio a bit and see if it is a bit more fluffier.
Delicious. I massaged the kale and added tuna to make a complete summer meal. And, I omitted the currants as I didn’t think it would work with the tuna.
I used raisins and dates instead of currants and ricotta instead of feta. Really good!
What a hit! Didn't change a thing with the recipe and it is a wonderful meal that will become one of my go-to's!!

Excellent! You can do so much with this salad, making it part of a main entree with meat, as a side dish or a side salad. I thought the dressing was very good, just needed more of it and added White Wine Vinegar to zip it up. Will definitely make again!

It was delicious! I added little bit of agave to give it a little sweetness as well as adding chopped shallots which gave it a lot of flavor. Instead of Pecans and currents, I added avocado, apples, and pumpkin seeds. It was healthy, delicious and was a hit with the whole family!

This is my go to dish. My kids and husband love it. The dressings is light and I always have the ingredients in the house. I did make a couple changes. I have one kid allergic to nuts (new nut allergy as a young adult) so no nuts. I added dried cranberries instead of raisins for I didn’t have any in the house. I also added shredded carrots for more color. I have made this soooo many times. Crowd pleaser!
I added cherry tomatoes

It was good and relatively easy to make. I didn't have currents and used Craisens instead. I also cut back on the lemon juice and salt. We felt it needed more seasoning, so would add more salt and other seasonings as well. It is healthy and makes a great side dish or base for proteins instead of rice.
Excellent!

We loved this easy salad. I will make it again and take to potlucks. I did add tomatoes because we had some and it was nice color. I also massaged the kale and put the quinoa in warm. It was excellent. A true keeper
I make this when I can get fresh kale, we love it. I may change something now and then according to what I have on hand. This receipt is perfect as it is.
Made 2 times for BBQs and it was a hit. Didn't have dried fruit so I added agave to the dressing. Also substituted sunflower seeds for nuts.

This is now a family favorite and something special we make as a side when we want to impress a crowd. The recipe is flexible; I’ve used pecans or walnuts and craisins in place of currants. I like to double the dressing amount so the kale gets a little softer. So good!

This salad is AMAZING. Before adding the dressing, I massaged the kale with a little olive oil and salt. I was trying to use what I had on hand, so I subbed craisins for the currants, stilton for the feta, and almonds for the pecans. One of the best salads I've ever had!
One of my family’s favorites! (Even my teenage boys!) we tend to double the dressing portion as my kids like it a bit more - live on it during the summer.
Excellent. Helped me use a bounty of kale from our garden! I did add about 1/4 tsp. sugar to the dressing.
Added red onion, cucumber and avocado. I also added a tiny bit of honey to the salad dressing. Sooooo good...
I mainly used this recipe for the dressing and it is absolutely delicious with kale. Reminds me of the kale salad at Barnes and Nobles. Dressing is a keeper. Thanks for the recipe.
No salt, and change to dried cranberries instead of currants. Very tasty.
Was excited to try this but came away unimpressed. The flavors didn't seem to compliment each other very much.
This salad is best recipe,my family love it is nutritious,delicious and very ice to make and the best thing is,that it taste better the next day so you can make a lot of it ...thanks for the recipe
I like it best with goat cheese and pears
I did not care for this at all. i thought it lacked flavor and was bitter. on the up side it is heaalthy.

This salad is delicious! I have never made a salad with kale before and it turned out great. I thought it would be a little bland so I added red pepper flakes, cayenne pepper and cumin to taste to the quinoa after cooking. I used horseradish mustard instead of Dijon. And I added a chopped up cucumber and jalapeno that I mixed up in a bit of extra dressing before adding. I used almonds instead of pecans because that is what I had on hand. Super delicious to have for lunch the next day. Will definitely make again!
The kale is a bit chewy/tough. Could it be quickly blanched and cooled down before eating? This is good and I love the dressing!
I loved this salad. I didn't have feta cheese but my husband doesn't like that cheese.

Terrific way to use kale! I made this for a party of 24 and it was a huge hit! Everyone loved it. Didn't need to put hot quinoa on it - the kale was tender and everything was perfect. Although there is no need to change anything as it is already perfect, I also made it with tomatoes and avocado, and craisins, just to see how it changed it, and it also was great. The dressing is perfect when you need a "lighter weight" dressing.
Delicious and healthy! Great side dish for summer. I used lacinato kale and it kept well for a few days since kale doesn't get wilty or soggy.
We love this recipe. I like it better if you make it ahead and don't eat it immediately after making it. It gives the flavors time to mingle.
This is my favorite salad. I use dried cranberries instead of currants.
Even people who said they didn’t like kale liked this at our potluck. And kale looks beautiful in the garden.

Needs half as much pepper, no garlic, and a nut that's less expensive than pecans. Raisins (chopped) should be OK instead of currants. Not sure whether the salt is useful, given the feta. The "prep time" of 5 minutes is ridiculously wrong.
Lovely and tasty recipe. We love middle eastern dishes. We have made this several times since discovering this recipe. Thank you!
Hands down, my favorite kale recipe!
Delicious! Substitutes based on what I had/ raisins and pine nuts. Also added kale when still warm. Really tasty!! Thanks!
I used craisins instead of currants & skipped the feta.

Absolutely delicious. I took the advice of another reviewer and massaged the kale with a teaspoon of sea salt. Great advice. It made the kale much more palatable. Also, we didn't have currents, so I substituted dried Michigan cherries. I'll be making this again. Healthy and delectable!

Very versatile... made 1 and1/2 dressing; replaced currants with dried cranberries. Sprinkled with sliced green onions. Added pinch of cayenne to dressing because that's what we do to most savory dishes. This will be a summer staple. Maybe with smoked salmon or chicken for complete meal.
Delicious dressing! I had no currants or feta and substituted fresh diced apple. It worked really well. Yum! Also halved the quinoa.
I used A balsamic glaze for my dressing and I loved it ! Also I used walnuts instead of pecans. (that's what I had on hand)
A healthy crowd favorite. Made it just as written a few times, but did an avocado as one reviewer suggested this last time and it made it all the better. Love this one.
I added a chicken stock cube when cooking the quinoa and I used raisins instead of currants

I've used pumpkin seeds instead of pecans and dried cranberries instead of currants. I also follow the advice of the previous cook to put the quinoa on the kale when it's warm to steam the kale just a little bit. This recipe has become a family favourite.
It was delicious! Not a kale fan, but this was wonderful & easy to make. I'll make it again!
Definetly will make again!

I do massage the kale as per cookie's advice in the reviews. I use dried cranberries instead of currants because I don't have currants sitting around. In fact, I don't think I've ever even tasted a currant. Otherwise, I do follow the recipe and it is always delicious.

I do massage the kale as per cookie's advice in the reviews. I use dried cranberries instead of currants because I don't have currants sitting around. In fact, I don't think I've ever even tasted a currant. Otherwise, I do follow the recipe and it is always delicious.

This was delicious. I wasn't sure how much kale to use, since I used baby kale, so I just used what looked right to me. I didn't have any currents, so I used raisins. They added a nice sweet flavor to the salad. I will definitely be making this again.

My first time using Kale in anything and I'm a vegetable lover. Instead of currents I used Craisins and instead of pecans I used slivered almonds. I liked it and people that are salad and vegetable lovers liked it but not sure some of the guys were over the moon about it. It's not something that I would serve or eat weekly but occasionally having kale is not bad.

Loved it and would definitely make it again! I halfed the recipe since I only cook for 2. Even then, I used about half the quinoa recommended and it was delicious. I used golden raisins over currents since it was all I had. Goat cheese over Feta. It was perfect and made a lot of salad. Luckily, kale keeps well overnight and I had the remaining salad the next day. Couldn't tell the difference.

Cut kale in small pieces, steamed it for 1 min. Added 2 Tbsp honey to dressing. Next time I will try substituting 1/2 of the lemon juice with Red Wine Vinegar. Added only enough quinoa to taste, probably not all that was called for. Used Craisins instead of currants.

The recipe was reduced to 2 servings and dried cranberries was used in place of the currants. The sweetness from the dried cranberries and saltiness of the feta was a perfect combination. I plan on making this one again. Thank you for sharing.
Crowd pleaser! Even those new Tonka

Make sure to pre-soak the quinoa a few hours, and rinse really well to wash off the saponins that will give a bitter taste, before cooking. Don't overcook. Great salad recipe - really versatile! Massaging kale does work.
Excellent! I added roasted cauliflower, pistachios instead of pecans, and queso fresco. Yum!
Delicious! I subbed goat cheese for feta and did 1/2c golden raisins and 1/2c craisins instead of currents
I did with the others suggested, putting the quinoa in warm, I also added balsamic vinegar. Turned out fantastic!

I made this recipe to go with a low-calorie honey mustard chicken breast dish I found on another website. I loved this recipe SO much that I had it for breakfast the next day! I didn't have any dried berries so I used candied almonds I had on hand instead to add sweetness. I also added dried onion to the dressing to amp up the savory spice. I will definitely add this too my side dish rotation (and breakfast rotation!) my kids even devoured it! All hail kale recipes I don't have to bribe my kids and hubby to eat!

Love this salad. I have made it for guests and they ask for the recipe.

The only thing I have changed is increase the feta and currants portions.

So delicious! I made this to take to a salad luncheon and I used fresh kale from my garden. I opted to use dried cranberries instead of the currents because that's what I had on hand. I also left off the feta cheese even though I love good feta I didn't want the other flavors to be overwhelmed by the feta. It was SO GOOD! The dressing and the other ingredients had just the right flavor and texture blend. The people at the luncheon complimented me on it and when my brother tried it he said (by way of a compliment) "This doesn't even TASTE like kale." I'll take that as a pretty good compliment because I'm always trying to get my parents and family to eat more kale and sometimes they are reluctant. But both my parents as well as my brother and sister ate this and seemed to enjoy it.

I "massaged" the kale and it turned out beautifully. I did, however, add a dash of sugar to the dressing portion and I left out the pecans since we have nut allergies. Everyone at dinner raved and fortunately there's enough left over for my lunch today!
All the flavors worked very well together. Will for sure make this again!

Very flavorful salad. A very filling, hearty meal in itself. Great balance of flavors. I did omit 2 of the 3 Tablespoons of olive oil as I didn't find the extra fat and calories necessary. By request, I'm making it again for a potluck today. The kale holds up pretty well overnight in the fridge, so leftovers still taste good the next day.
The dressing was delicious! This will be a go-to kale recipe for me. Also this was the first time I made quinoa and I'm officially a fan. What a simple yet tasty combination of flavors.
Awesome salad! Only change I made was I used raisins instead of currents, and didn't add any mustard in the dressing. I was blown away how tasty this was. Will be making this more often :)

Awesome and versatile recipe. First time I made it I used walnuts instead of pecans and blue cheese instead of feta. If you add the quinoa hot off the stove, it melts the blue cheese and is just...just great. 

I've also added a can of drained black beans to this recipe as well as a sliced chicken breast for additional protein.

Great in a wrap as a meal to go.

I am so addicted to this salad. The dressing is fabulous. The only change I make is to cut back a little on the Quinoa. I only use half the amount the recipe calls for, and I use chopped dried cherries instead of currants.

This recipe is terrific -- it's healthy, filling, a great mix of salty and sweet. I had eaten a similar salad at Moss Beach Distillery in Half Moon Bay, CA and was looking for one similar to it. I replaced the currants with dried cranberries, and replaced the pecans with macadamia nuts. The salad was a huge hit with my daughters too. Will definitely make again!

This is a total party pleaser and healthy! I never have left overs! Love it! 

I add more mustard and add more kale to make an extra half a batch.

I really like this recipe. Added too much kale once so it was a bit dry, used Italian bottled dressing in addition & it was loved by all. I use craisins instead of currants, regular mustard & regular salt & pepper as I cannot get the more gourmet ingredients. I do massage the kale with the dressing & add the quinoa warm then refrigerate before adding the feta. This is a great salad for the holidays, a step above "normal"!!

This recipe has great bones. This isn't a kapow! dish, but any issue with bland flavours might be due to too little salt or olive oil. I took the other reviewers' comments and made a few alterations to make sure it was flavourful. I massaged the kale with salt and good olive oil which made it amazing and soft. I also cooked the quinoa in vegetable stock. For the dressing, I put the garlic, salt, mustard, olive oil and lemon juice in a mortar and pestle and ground to a purée and added some dried herbs. Then it sat for the 15 minutes it took the quinoa to cook which helps the garlic flavour get into the dressing. I prefer walnuts, so toasted them in the stove before adding. I ate the salad warmed from the quinoa, which was amazing. In the future I will add some cherry tomatoes. Delicious.
I love this salad, I make it every summer. its healthy and very tasty. I even make big bottle of the dressing for other salads.
It had little flavo. We prefer dried cranberries with this combination. Won't make it again.

This was fabulous, although I was in too much of a rush to make the dressing from scratch and instead poured over a fig-balsamic-vinaigrette from the fridge. Outstanding! And I recommend adding the quinoa warm: it was fabulous warm.
Cooked the quinoa in chicken stock with lots of garlic. Delicious!!

First of all, if you massage the kale in sea salt, don't add any additional salt in the dressing or to the quinoa. With the feta it made it too salty. Next time I would massage the kale with the salad dressing and salt at the end to taste. I added chopped red onions, a splash of white balsamic and even my "I hate kale" husband liked it! I will be making this again! Great for wheat free diets too.
Very good. I used a pouch of quinoa and brown rice that took 90 seconds to heat so this was almost fast food. I used dried cranberries, no currants.
I would leave out the pecans...they added nothing. I substituted dried cranberries for the currants...nice balance with the feta. Great salad! Loved it and have shared it.
Hubby made & he did add some honey to the dressing. We both liked this & was easy to make. I make the quinoa up early & he does the rest later.
Loved it! I made it and served for 2, instead of 6. I used 1TBSP less oil, fig instead of currant. Tossing roasted chicken breast was also good idea.

Wow, this is by far the best salad I've ever made! Kale and quinoa are two daunting ingredients and although both are thoroughly nutritious, I've steered clear of them due to not having the confidence to prepare them well. This was my first stab at using both kale and quinoa and the salad turned out amazingly well, and healthy to boot! I followed the recipe almost exactly, except that I couldn't find dried currants at the local grocery store. Instead, I used Mariani dried tart cherries (they add sugar to them). One tip for prepping the kale: cut out the middle stalk on each leaf and discard before shredding the lettuce. The stalk is pretty tough and doesn't go well in a salad.

I discovered this recipe last summer and get rave reviews whenever I make it. I do double the dressing because it didn't seem to have much flavor before I did that. I also put the hot quinoa on the kale to wilt it a little as others have suggested. This is just so good! Thank you for sharing the recipe.

Yum! I did make a couple substitutions, due to what was on hand: red wine vinegar as I was out of lemons, some raisins in lieu of currants, and I'm not a pecan fan so I used pistachios. One thing I will try next time (and there will be a next time!) is adding a little honey to the dressing, as I think it could use a little more sweetness to counter the salty feta. All around, a solid base recipe!

Really like this recipe, particularly since I have been making lifestyle changes and ate quinoa for the first time with nothing on it. Hated it. I dared to order the quinoa and kale salad at Zupas but their dressing was high on vinegar. I've since ordered it again and it was perfect so it was just that batch. So I wanted to duplicate it. This comes very close. I've added my own twists to it but it's great just the way it is. For a slightly different taste, I added baby sweet corn, a couple of sweet small, sweet peppers, and a sweeter vinegarette. You might see the pattern here. Have a sweet tooth. Also added cilantro. So, it's great the way it is. But it's also great with a little sweeter taste.

Wow! I loved this - pretty much made as is, with kale from the garden, massaging the kale a little with dressing prior to adding other ingredients. Light, good flavors & feels like such a healthy thing to eat. Wonderful!
Slivered almond and dried cranberries instead plus shredded carrot and added honey to the dressing. Yum! Oh, and no feta. I guess I basically made a different recipe.

Fantastic base recipe. I love to alter the 'extras'. You can change the lemon juice out for vinegars and then add whatever you'd like! Today's stars asparagus and red peppers, but you can basically put anything in it!

One of my new go to recipes. The store was out of currents so I used dried blue berries instead, which I actually preferred. I massaged the kale as one other member suggested. That was a great tip! As for it being "blah", feel free to adjust the mustard and lemon to your liking, and cook the quinoa using vegetable or chicken stock.

I used fresh kale from the garden, however, next time I will use more kale than what is listed on this recipe. The salad was more quinoa than kale, and I would prefer it with more kale than quinoa. The salad dressing was not the greatest. I added some white balsamic vinegar and that seemed to make it taste better. I liked the Best Greek Quinoa Salad, Quinoa & Black Bean, and Mediterranean Quinoa Salad recipes on this website better than this one. TIPS: From what I read on the other recipes, it's best to rinse water over the quinoa before cooking. I also set aside the stalks and ribs of the kale for my morning green drink and only use the leafy tender part in salads.

This is a GREAT base recipe. The dressing is light so for those who want a heavy dressing - perhaps you'll want to spice it up but our family prefers the "touch" of flavor. Do salt and pepper to taste as I found the salt to be a bit much but taste it by dipping a leaf or two of kale; off the spoon it's VERY salty but with the kale it goes perfectly. I preferred about 1/2 the amount the salt and 1/4 the amount of pepper as the dijon is already peppery. The garlic was way too overpowering for me. 1/4 the amount as well, if at all. I actually preferred it with garlic powder.

So delish! I used cous cous instead of quinoa bc that's what I had. Also I used baby kale and massaged it to make it easier to eat. Finally, I used parmesan instead of feta because I wanted something less sharp.
